IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROMOTE PROFESSIONAL, COMPETENT, ETHICAL AND COMPASSIONATE HEALTH CARE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WE ARE A NONPROFIT, COMMUNITY BASED HEALTH CARE NETWORK WHOSE MISSION IS TO PROMOTE PROFESSIONAL, COMPETENT, ETHICAL AND COMPASSIONATE HEALTH CARE IN THE NAME OF CHRIST TO INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITY.
IRS990.Desc: ANCILLARY SERVICES - HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES IS A 13-BED COMMUNITY-BASED HEALTH CARE NETWORK LOCATED IN THE HEART OF RURAL NEBRASKA. ANCILLARY SERVICES PROVIDED INCLUDE RADIOLOGY, LABORATORY, OPERATING AND RECOVERY ROOMS, PHYSICAL, RESPIRATORY, INTRAVENOUS, OCCUPATIONAL AND SPEECH THERAPIES, CENTRAL SERVICES, EMERGENCY ROOM, SPECIALTY CLINIC, ANESTHESIOLOGY, ELECTROCARDIOLOGY, CARDIAC AND PULMONARY REHABILITATION, LABOR AND DELIVERY ROOMS AND DIABETIC EDUCATION.IN FISCAL YEAR 2023, THE HOSPITAL PROVIDED 2,930 RADIOLOGY PROCEDURES AND 2,994 PHYSICAL THERAPY VISITS, SAW 740 VISITS TO THE EMERGENCY ROOM AND PERFORMED 221 OPERATIONS. HENDERSON PROVIDED 286 PATIENT DAYS OF ACUTE CARE AND 505 PATIENT DAYS OF SWING-BED CARE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: RURAL HEALTH CLINICS - THIS ENCOMPASSES TWO PROVIDER BASED RHCS, ONE LOCATED ADJACENT TO THE CAH AND ONE SATELLITE CLINIC IN SUTTON WHICH OFFERS EXPANDED LAB AND X-RAY. WE EMPLOY 3 MDS AND 4 PAS TO STAFF THESE CLINICS ALONG WITH NURSING AND ADMISSION STAFF. BEING LOCATED NEAR THE INTERSTATE WE ARE ABLE TO SERVE THOSE TRAVELING THROUGH WITH HEALTHCARE NEEDS, BUT OUR GENERAL SERVICE AREA INCLUDES HENDERSON, YORK, HAMPTON, BRADSHAW, MCCOOL, SUTTON, CLAY CENTER, AND AURORA. WE AVERAGE OVER 10,000 CLINIC VISITS BETWEEN THE TWO LOCATIONS AND WE PROVIDE FAMILY PRACTICE SERVICES INCLUDING OBSTETRIC CARE, GERIATRIC CARE, AND PEDIATRIC CARE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: PHARMACY/ONCOLOGY - SALARIES INCLUDE A FULL TIME PHARMACIST AND PART TIME PHARMACY TECHNICIAN THAT PERFORMS MEDICATION ORDER REVIEWS FOR ALL MEDICATIONS ORDERED FOR THE HHCS CAH, THIS PHARMACIST ALSO PERFORMS THE MONTHLY INTERNAL REVIEW OF PHARMACY/MEDICATION FOR THE CAH AND LTC. SUPPLIES EXPENSE IS MOSTLY COMPOSED OF MEDICATION COSTS FOR ALL THE MEDICATIONS ADMINISTERED TO THE ER, OP, IP, SK AND OPO PATIENTS AT HHCS. MEDICATIONS ARE PURCHASED MOSTLY THROUGH CARDINAL.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: LTC NURSING - WE ARE A 40-BED LTC NON-MEDICARE CERTIFIED FACILITY, WE SERVE A MIXTURE OF PRIVATE AND MEDICAID PATIENTS AND FOR FISCAL YEAR 2023 WE HAD 87% OCCUPANCY. THE LARGEST SINGLE COST WITHIN THIS DEPARTMENT IS SALARIES AS THEY CARRY 26.3 FTES IN THIS DEPARTMENT, WHICH INCLUDES AN ASSISTANT ADMINISTRATOR, DIRECTOR OF NURSING, AND ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF NURSING. THE NEXT HIGHEST COSTS ARE THE EMPLOYEE BENEFITS FOR THE STAFF, INCLUDING HEALTH INSURANCE AND RETIREMENT PLAN. WE ALSO INCUR A QUARTERLY ASSESSMENT TAX FROM NE DHHS, ASSESSED AT $3.50 PER BED PER RESIDENT DAY SO APPROXIMATELY $44,000 PER YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A PORTION OF THE DUES PAID TO THE NEBRASKA HOSPITAL ASSOCIATION (NHA) ARE USED BY THOSE ORGANIZATIONS FOR LOBBYING ACTIVITIES.

HHCS ACCOUNTS FOR UNCERTAINTIES IN ACCOUNTING FOR INCOME TAX ASSETS AND LIABILITIES USING GUIDANCE INCLUDED IN FASB ASC 740, INCOME TAXES. HHCS RECOGNIZES THE EFFECT OF INCOME TAX POSITIONS ONLY IF THOSE POSITIONS ARE MORE LIKELY THAN NOT OF BEING SUSTAINED. AT JUNE 30, 2023 AND 2022, HHCS HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS ACCRUED.
RENTAL EXPENSES 3,736. GAIN ON BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN TRUSTS 79,584.
IMPLICIT PRICE CONCESSIONS 163,705.
RENTAL EXPENSES 3,736.
IMPLICIT PRICE CONCESSIONS 163,705.

SupplementalInformationGrp.ExplanationTxt: PART V, SECTION B, LINE 5: THIS ASSESSMENT FOCUSES ON COLLECTING THE COMMUNITY'S PERSPECTIVE ON ISSUES SUCH AS HEALTH CARE, EDUCATION, CARE FOR OLDER ADULTS, JOBS, SUPPORT NETWORKS, HEALTH PROBLEMS, AND RISKY BEHAVIORS. A SURVEY WAS DESIGNED BY UTILIZING A SAMPLE SURVEY PROVIDED BY NACCHO. AN UPDATED SURVEY WAS DESIGNED AND DISTRIBUTED IN 2021. THE SURVEY WAS DISTRIBUTED THROUGHOUT THE DISTRICT TO COMMUNITY MEETINGS SUCH AS ROTARY, KIWANIS, OR SERTOMA CLUBS. THEY WERE TAKEN TO AREA CHURCHES, SCHOOL EVENTS, COUNTY FAIRS, ETC. THE SURVEY WAS ALSO AVAILABLE ONLINE AT SURVEY MONKEY. RESPONSES WERE RECEIVED FROM 1,701 INDIVIDUALS.
PART V, SECTION B, LINE 6B: FOUR CORNERS HEALTH DEPARTMENT

PART V, SECTION B, LINE 11: HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES, INC. CONTINUES TO PUT FORTH RESOURCES TO ADDRESS THE IDENTIFIED NEEDS AS FOLLOWS:1) OBESITY/NUTRITION/PHYSICAL ACTIVITY: HHCS PROMOTES HEALTHY LIFESTYLES BY PARTNERING WITH FOUR CORNERS HEALTH DEPARTMENT, SPONSORING AN ANNUAL COMMUNITY WEIGHT LOSS CHALLENGE, OFFERING AN ANNUAL HEALTH FAIR TO EMPLOYEES AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC, OFFERING WELLNESS CENTER ACCESS TO EMPLOYEES AND THE PUBLIC, AND PROVIDING NUTRITIONAL COUNSELING AND DIABETIC EDUCATION TO PATIENTS. 2) CANCER: HHCS CONTINUES TO PROMOTE CANCER AWARENESS BY PARTNERING WITH FOUR CORNERS HEALTH DEPARTMENT, RELEASING MESSAGES TO THE PUBLIC ENCOURAGING SCREENING AND EARLY DETECTION IN THE LOCAL NEWSPAPER, WEBSITE OR QUARTERLY NEWSLETTER, AND HOST COMMUNITY HEALTH EVENTS.3) MENTAL HEALTH: HHCS PROMOTES MENTAL HEALTH BY MAKING APPROPRIATE MENTAL HEALTH REFERRALS WHEN DEEMED NECESSARY AND DEVELOPING A CLEAR AND CONSISTENT MESSAGE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND PATIENTS OF HHCS. THIS INCLUDES SPONSORING A SPEAKER AT THE HEARTLAND COMMUNITY SCHOOL AND SUTTON PUBLIC SCHOOL FOCUSING ON SUICIDE PREVENTION/MENTAL HEALTH AMONGST TEENAGERS, CYBER BULLYING AND RISKY BEHAVIORS, AND CONTRACTING FOR EMERGENCY SERVICES WHERE MENTAL HEALTH COORDINATION CAN BE INITIATED.4) ALCOHOL/DRUG ABUSE: HHCS PROVIDES SUPPORT FOR ALCOHOL/DRUG ABUSE BY COLLABORATING WITH THE LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEM TO EDUCATE AND BE A RESOURCE FOR MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY. OF THE NEEDS IDENTIFIED, THERE WERE NO SIGNIFICANT NEEDS THAT ARE NOT BEING ADDRESSED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A PATIENT KNOWS IF THEY ARE ELIGIBLE AFTER THEY SUBMIT AN APPLICATION AND IT IS REVIEWED BY THE CFO THEN SUBMITTED TO THE CEO OR BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR FINAL DETERMINATION. ONCE A DETERMINATION IS MADE, A FORMAL LETTER IS DRAFTED AND SENT TO THE PATIENT LETTING THEM KNOW OF THE DECISION. THERE IS PRESUMPTIVE ELIGIBILITY AND MEDICALLY INDIGENT AVAILABLE FOR QUALIFYING OPTIONS.
THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT PREPARE A COMMUNITY BENEFIT REPORT DURING THE YEAR.
HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES, INC. USED THE WORKSHEETS PROVIDED IN THE IRS INSTRUCTIONS FOR SCHEDULE H IN ADDITION TO THE INTERNAL COST ACCOUNTING SYSTEM.
THE BAD DEBT EXPENSE INCLUDED ON FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 25, COLUMN (A), BUT SUBTRACTED FOR PURPOSES OF CALCULATING THE PERCENTAGE IN THIS COLUMN IS $163,705.

HHCS IS THE LARGEST EMPLOYER IN THE COMMUNITY WITH APPROXIMATELY 160 EMPLOYEES FROM THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES. THE DIRECTOR OF NURSING STAFF AND HUMAN RESOURCES REGULARLY ATTENDS JOB FAIRS PROMOTING HEALTH CARE POSITIONS. HHCS ALSO HOSTS THE HENDERSON HEARTLAND SCHOOL JUNIOR HIGH FOR A CAREER DAY IN WHICH THEY COME FOR A TOUR OF THE FACILITY TO LEARN ABOUT THE VAST ARRAY OF JOBS OFFERED WITHIN THE HEALTHCARE INDUSTRY. THE HOSPITAL OFFERS AN ANNUAL HEALTH FAIR LAB PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES REDUCED COST TESTS FOR THE PUBLIC, HHCS ALSO PROMOTES HEALTHCARE AT THE SUTTON AND HENDERSON ANNUAL HOME SHOWS.

CONSISTENT WITH HHCS' MISSION, CARE IS PROVIDED TO PATIENTS REGARDLESS OF THEIR ABILITY TO PAY. THEREFORE, HHCS HAS PROVIDED IMPLICIT PRICE CONCESSIONS TO UNINSURED PATIENTS AND PATIENTS WITH UNINSURED BALANCES (COPAYS AND DEDUCTIBLES). THE IMPLICIT PRICE CONCESSIONS INCLUDED IN ESTIMATING TRANSACTION PRICE REPRESENT THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN AMOUNTS BILLED TO PATIENTS AND THE AMOUNTS HHCS EXPECTS TO COLLECT BASED ON COLLECTION HISTORY WITH THOSE PATIENTS.

THE ORGANIZATION REVIEWED THEIR BAD DEBTS WRITTEN OFF DURING THE YEAR AS WELL AS PAST EXPERIENCE WITH PATIENTS SERVED AND DETERMINED APPROXIMATELY 20% OF BAD DEBT ACCOUNTS WRITTEN OFF WOULD HAVE QUALIFIED FOR CHARITY CARE IF THE INDIVIDUALS WOULD HAVE COMPLETED THE APPLICATION PROCESS.

THE HOSPITAL'S FINANCIAL STATMENTS DO NOT CONTAIN A SPECIFIC FOOTNOTE DESCRIBING BAD DEBT. HOWEVER, PAGES 10, 12, 13 AND 14 OF THE ATTACHED AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS INCLUDE FOOTNOTES TITLED "PATIENT RECEIVABLES", "PATIENT SERVICE REVENUE AND "PATIENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE".

THE INFORMATION IS FROM THE MEDICARE COST REPORT WHICH IS BASED ON ROUTINE COST PER DAY AND COST TO CHARGE RATIOS. A SHORTFALL REPRESENTS ACTUAL UNREIMBURSED COSTS INCURRED BY THE HOSPITAL IN PROVIDING SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS ELIGIBLE FOR MEDICARE. THIS IS A BENEFIT TO THE COMMUNITY AS IT IS PROVIDED BELOW COST.

HHCS RESERVES THE RIGHT TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE EVEN THOUGH AN APPLICATION HAS NOT BEEN SUBMITTED FOR THE APPLICABLE CARE. HHCS MAY UTILIZE PREVIOUS FAP APPLICATIONS TO DETERMINE THE ASSISTANCE PROVIDED TO THE PATIENT. IF THE PATIENT IS PROVIDED LESS THAN THE MAXIMUM POSSIBLE LEVEL OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, HHCS WILL: - NOTIFY THE PATIENT REGARDING THE BASIS FOR THE PRESUMPTIVE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE; - NOTIFY THE PATIENT AS TO HOW TO APPLY FOR POTENTIALLY MORE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE; - GIVE THE PATIENT A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME TO APPLY FOR MORE GENEROUS ASSISTANCE BEFORE INITIATING COLLECTION ACTIONS; AND - IF THE INDIVIDUAL SUBMITS A COMPLETED APPLICATION SEEKING ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE DURING THE LATER OF THE APPLICATION PERIOD OR THE RESPONSE TIME SET FORTH IN THE NOTICE, PROCESS THE APPLICATION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POLICY.

MEDICAL STAFF MEETINGS (INCLUDES ADMINISTRATION, DONS, ALL EMPLOYED PROVIDERS, PHARMACISTS) AND PROVIDER MEETINGS (INCLUDES ONLY EMPLOYED PROVIDERS, CEO AND DON) ARE HELD MONTHLY DURING WHICH OUR MEDICAL STAFF HAVE AN OPPORTUNITY TO SHARE WHAT THEY ARE SEEING FOR RECURRING CASES OF DISEASE MANAGEMENT IN THEIR PATIENTS. IF A TREND IS IDENTIFIED THROUGH THAT DISCUSSION THEN WE TRY TO DEVELOP AN OUTREACH TO THE COMMUNITY. FOR EXAMPLE, PATIENT EDUCATION IN THE NEWSLETTER OR PAMPHLETS IN THE CLINIC EXAM ROOMS, IT BECOMES A FOCUS POINT FOR ALL PROVIDERS WHEN SEEING THEIR PATIENTS. WE MAY ALSO TURN TO COMMUNITY OUTREACH EDUCATION SESSIONS WHERE OUR STAFF HOLD "TOWN HALL" MEETINGS TO EDUCATE THOSE INTERESTED IN ATTENDING. WE ALSO HOLD ANNUAL HEALTH FAIR LABS AND WE COLLECTIVELY LOOK AT RESULTS TO DETERMINE ANY TRENDS IN HEALTH MANAGEMENT THAT NEED TO BE A FOCUS FOR OUR PROVIDERS FOR THE NEXT YEAR. THIS CAN HELP US IDENTIFY ADDITIONAL LAB OR RADIOLOGY TESTS THAT WE NEED TO OFFER IN OUR FACILITY. IT CAN ALSO TELL US IF WE NEED TO FOCUS ON A SPECIALTY CLINIC THAT MAY NEED TO BE RECRUITED TO PROVIDE THE SERVICE IN-HOUSE. LASTLY, WE HAVE PURCHASED KPI NINJA SOFTWARE THAT WILL ALLOW US TO DATA MINE OUR CLAIMS AND DIAGNOSIS SO WE CAN ANALYZE TO SEE WHAT TYPES OF HEALTH MANAGEMENT ARE PREVALENT IN OUR COMMUNITIES.

IT IS NOTED THAT HENDERSON HEALTH CARE OFFERS CHARITY CARE IN THE ADMISSION FORMS THAT ALL PATIENTS SIGN WHEN THEY COME TO THE CLINIC AND HOSPITAL AND THE FAP IS POSTED IN THE HOSPITAL WAITING ROOMS. ALSO, IN COLLECTION LETTERS, PATIENTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO CONTACT THE HOSPITAL IF THEY ARE INTERESTED IN APPLYING FOR CHARITY CARE. LASTLY, CHARITY CARE IS VERBALLY EXPLAINED TO PATIENTS IF THEY CALL STATING THEY CAN'T PAY FOR THEIR MEDICAL BILL. HHCS ALSO PUBLISHES A NOTICE ANNUALLY IN A NEWSLETTER THAT WE OFFER CHARITY CARE, AND WE PROVIDE OUR POLICY AND APPLICATIONS TO THE CLAY COUNTY AND YORK COUNTY HEALTH DEPARTMENT IN AN EFFORT TO REACH THOSE IN NEED. ALL PATIENT STATEMENTS INCLUDE THE NOTICE THAT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS OFFERED AND INCLUDES CONTACT INFORMATION TO OBTAIN THE APPLICATION.

HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES IS LOCATED IN HENDERSON, NEBRASKA PROVIDING HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO RURAL COMMUNITIES THAT PRIMARILY INCLUDE YORK COUNTY (13,665), CLAY COUNTY (6,624), AND HAMILTON COUNTY (9,132) RESPECTIVELY; APPROXIMATELY 30,000 IN TOTAL. HENDERSON HEALTH CARE PROVIDES HEALTH CARE SERVICES TO INFANTS, CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, ADULT MEN AND WOMEN, AND THE AGED. THERE IS AN AVERAGE OF 16.67 PERSONS PER SQUARE MILE IN THE SERVICE AREA COMPARED TO ABOUT 80 PER SQUARE MILE ACROSS THE UNITED STATES. THE RESIDENTS OF THESE COUNTIES ARE 97.44% WHITE WITH 17.64% OVER THE AGE OF 65 YEARS AND 5.94% BELOW POVERTY LEVEL.

HHCS OFFERS A FULL ARRAY OF HEALTH CARE SERVICES FROM BIRTH TO DEATH BY PROVIDING OBSTETRIC CARE ALL THE WAY TO LONG TERM CARE NEEDS AND RESPITE NEEDS. THE HOSPITAL BRINGS SPECIALISTS OF MANY AREAS TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING SPECIALTY CLINICS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY. THE HOSPITAL ALSO OFFERS A BABY BOOT CAMP FOR EXPECTING MOTHERS TO PROMOTE POSITIVE PRENATAL HEALTH AND EDUCATION FOR MOTHERS ABOUT PROPER BABY SAFETY AND IMMUNIZATIONS. PHYSICIANS DO SPEAKING ENGAGEMENTS AT THE SUTTON AND HENDERSON SCHOOLS ON VARIOUS HEALTH TOPICS RELATED TO THEIR AGE GROUP. HHCS HOSTS MEDICAL STUDENTS FOR ROTATION AND STRIVES TO EDUCATE THESE STUDENTS AND RESIDENTS. A QUARTERLY NEWSLETTER IS ISSUED THAT SPOTLIGHTS OUR NEW SERVICES BUT ALSO OFFERS A QUESTION AND ANSWER SESSION FOR HOT TOPICS WITH THE PROVIDERS. HHCS OFFERS 24 HOUR ER CARE AND WORKS WITH AVERA EMERGENCY PROGRAM TO PROVIDE THE BEST TRAUMA AND CRITICAL CARE TO ER PATIENTS. THE HOSPITAL ALSO OFFERS A DIABETES PREVENTION CLASS TO THE PUBLIC WHICH MEETS WEEKLY TO PROVIDE EDUCATION AND SUPPORT FOR ATTENDEES. AN EMPLOYED PHYSICAL THERAPIST IS PROVIDED TO THREE AREA SCHOOLS TO SERVE ON A WEEKLY BASIS AS THEIR ATHLETIC TRAINER; AT NO COST TO THE SCHOOL OR STUDENT.
HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES, INC. IS NOT A PART OF AN AFFILIATED HEALTH CARE SYSTEM.

PHYSICIAN BONUSES ARE DEPENDENT UPON THE INDIVIDUAL PHYSICIAN'S CHARGED FEES (ADJUSTED FOR CONTRACTUAL AGREEMENTS AND PHYSICIAN'S PERSONAL PROFESSIONAL SERVICES) AND ARE PAID OUT AS A PERCENTAGE OF REVENUE ABOVE A THRESHOLD, WHICH VARIES WITH PHYSICIAN'S PRODUCTIVITY. JAMES OHRT AND LINDSEY NELSON RECEIVED A PRODUCTIVITY BONUS DURING THE YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTS OF THE CHAIR, VICE CHAIR, SECRETARY, AND TREASURER. EXCEPT FOR POWER TO AMEND THE ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION AND BY-LAWS, THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE ALL OF THE POWERS AND AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN THE INTERVALS BETWEEN REGULAR MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, SUBJECT TO THE DIRECTION AND CONTROL OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EVERY PERSON, SOCIETY, BUSINESS OR CONGREGATION WHO HAS DONATED ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS OR MORE FOR THE BENEFIT OF HENDERSON HEALTH CARE SERVICES, INC.(HHCS) DURING THEIR LIFETIME SHALL BE A MEMBER OF HHCS. NO PERSON, SOCIETY, BUSINESS OR CONGREGATION SHALL BE ENTITLED TO MORE THAN ONE VOTE REGARDLESS OF THE CONTRIBUTIONS IN EXCESS OF ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS, AND A PERSON MUST BE OF LEGAL AGE TO EXERCISE VOTING PRIVILEGES. ACCEPTANCE OF ANY DONATION OF $100.00 OR MORE CONSTITUTES APPROVAL OF A LIFETIME MEMBERSHIP. THE MEMBERSHIP IS NOT TRANSFERABLE OR ASSIGNABLE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ARE ELECTED BY THE MEMBERSHIP AT THE ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE ACCOUNTING FIRM AND REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT. A FINAL COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH DIRECTOR, OFFICER AND MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE WITH BOARD-DELEGATED POWERS SHALL ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT THAT AFFIRMS THAT SUCH PERSON: 1) HAS RECEIVED A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, 2) HAS READ AND UNDERSTANDS THE POLICY, 3) HAS AGREED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY, AND 4) UNDERSTANDS THAT THE CORPORATION IS A TAX EXEMPT CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION AND THAT IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS FEDERAL TAX EXEMPTION IT MUST ENGAGE PRIMARILY IN ACTIVITIES THAT ACCOMPLISH ONE OR MORE OF ITS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES. AFTER DISCLOSURE OF THE FINANCIAL INTEREST AND ALL MATERIAL FACTS, AND AFTER ANY DISCUSSION WITH THE INTERESTED PERSON, HE/SHE SHALL LEAVE THE BOARD OR COMMITTEE MEETING WHILE THE DETERMINATION OF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS DISCUSSED AND VOTED UPON. ANY PERSON WITH A POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST IN ANY MATTER SHOULD NOT VOTE OR USE HIS/HER PERSONAL INFLUENCE ON THE MATTER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO IS DETERMINED BY A FACILITY EVALUATION TOOL COMPLETED BY THE BOARD PRESIDENT AND REVIEWED WITH AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE CEO OVERSEES THE REMAINING OFFICERS AND COMPLETES THE FACILITY EVALUATION TOOL FOR THOSE OFFICERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE DISTRIBUTED AT THE ANNUAL MEETING TO THOSE IN ATTENDANCE AND ARE ALSO AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
GAIN ON BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN TRUSTS 79,584.

THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS ASSUMES THE RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF HHCS'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT. THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED SINCE THE PRIOR YEAR.
